questions.question: To hit the nail on the head

options.A: To describe exactly what is causing a situation

questions.explanation: This idiom means to be exactly right about something or to identify the precise issue.

questions.question: To let the cat out of the bag
questions.explanation: This idiom means to accidentally or deliberately reveal a secret.

questions.question: To be in hot water

options.A: To be in a comfortable situation

questions.explanation: Being in hot water means being in a difficult or troublesome situation.

questions.question: To cost an arm and a leg
questions.explanation: Something that costs an arm and a leg is extremely expensive.

questions.question: To kill two birds with one stone

options.B: To achieve two things at once

questions.explanation: This idiom means to accomplish two different things with a single action.

questions.question: To bite the bullet

options.A: To endure a painful situation bravely

questions.explanation: Biting the bullet means facing a difficult or unpleasant situation with courage.

questions.question: To burn the midnight oil

options.B: To work late into the night

questions.explanation: This idiom means to stay up late working or studying.

questions.question: To call it a day

options.B: To stop working for the day

questions.explanation: Calling it a day means deciding to stop what you are doing for the rest of the day.

questions.question: To cut corners

options.B: To do something poorly to save time or money

questions.explanation: Cutting corners means doing something in the easiest or cheapest way, often sacrificing quality.

questions.question: To feel under the weather
questions.explanation: Feeling under the weather means feeling unwell or sick.

questions.question: To give the benefit of the doubt
questions.explanation: Giving the benefit of the doubt means choosing to believe someone even though you are not sure they are telling the truth.

questions.question: To go the extra mile
questions.explanation: Going the extra mile means making more effort than is expected.

questions.question: To hit the sack
questions.explanation: Hitting the sack means going to sleep.

questions.question: To jump on the bandwagon
questions.explanation: Jumping on the bandwagon means joining a popular activity or trend.

questions.question: To keep your chin up

options.B: To remain cheerful in difficult times

questions.explanation: Keeping your chin up means staying positive and cheerful during a difficult time.

questions.question: To let sleeping dogs lie

options.A: To avoid interfering in a situation that might cause trouble

questions.explanation: Letting sleeping dogs lie means not interfering in a situation because it could cause problems.

questions.question: To make a long story short
questions.explanation: Making a long story short means summarizing a long account.

questions.question: Once in a blue moon
questions.explanation: Once in a blue moon means very rarely.

questions.question: Piece of cake
questions.explanation: A piece of cake means something very easy to do.

questions.question: To spill the beans
questions.explanation: Spilling the beans means revealing a secret.

questions.question: To take with a grain of salt
questions.explanation: Taking something with a grain of salt means not completely believing it.

questions.question: To throw in the towel
questions.explanation: Throwing in the towel means giving up or admitting defeat.

questions.question: To turn a blind eye
questions.explanation: Turning a blind eye means deliberately ignoring something.

questions.question: To be up in arms
questions.explanation: Being up in arms means being very angry and protesting.

questions.question: Wild goose chase
questions.explanation: A wild goose chase is a search or pursuit that is pointless or futile.

questions.question: To beat around the bush
questions.explanation: Beating around the bush means talking about something without getting to the point.

questions.question: To break the ice
questions.explanation: Breaking the ice means initiating conversation in a social setting to reduce tension.

questions.question: To cry over spilt milk

options.A: To be sad about the past
options.B: To regret something that cannot be undone

questions.explanation: Crying over spilt milk means being upset about something that has already happened and cannot be changed.

questions.question: To cut the mustard
questions.explanation: Cutting the mustard means meeting the required standard or expectation.

questions.question: To face the music
questions.explanation: Facing the music means accepting the unpleasant consequences of one's actions.

questions.question: To get a taste of your own medicine

options.A: To be treated the way you treat others

questions.explanation: Getting a taste of your own medicine means experiencing the same unpleasant treatment you have given to others.

questions.question: To give the cold shoulder
questions.explanation: Giving the cold shoulder means deliberately ignoring someone.

questions.question: To have a heart of gold
questions.explanation: Having a heart of gold means being extremely kind and generous.

questions.question: In the same boat
questions.explanation: Being in the same boat means being in the same difficult circumstances as others.

questions.question: To keep your fingers crossed
questions.explanation: Keeping your fingers crossed means hoping for a positive outcome.

questions.question: To let off steam
questions.explanation: Letting off steam means releasing pent-up energy or emotions, often through physical activity.

questions.question: To make ends meet
questions.explanation: Making ends meet means earning enough money to live on.

questions.question: On the ball
questions.explanation: Being on the ball means being quick to understand and react to things.

questions.question: To pull someone's leg
questions.explanation: Pulling someone's leg means teasing or joking with them.

questions.question: To put all your eggs in one basket

options.A: To risk everything on one venture

questions.explanation: Putting all your eggs in one basket means risking everything on a single opportunity.

questions.question: To ring a bell
questions.explanation: If something rings a bell, it sounds familiar or reminds you of something.

questions.question: To see eye to eye

options.D: To be at the same level

questions.explanation: Seeing eye to eye means agreeing with someone.

questions.question: To sit on the fence
questions.explanation: Sitting on the fence means avoiding making a decision or choice.

questions.question: To steal someone's thunder

options.A: To take credit for someone else's idea

questions.explanation: Stealing someone's thunder means taking attention or credit away from someone else.

questions.question: To take it easy
questions.explanation: Taking it easy means relaxing and not working too hard.

questions.question: The ball is in your court

options.A: It's your decision or turn to act

questions.explanation: When the ball is in your court, it means it is your turn to take action or make a decision.

questions.question: Through thick and thin
questions.explanation: Through thick and thin means in all circumstances, both good and bad.

questions.question: When pigs fly
questions.explanation: When pigs fly is a humorous way of saying something will never happen.

questions.question: You can't judge a book by its cover
questions.explanation: This means you should not form an opinion based solely on outward appearance.

questions.question: To add insult to injury

options.A: To make a bad situation worse

questions.explanation: Adding insult to injury means making a bad situation even worse.

questions.question: Meaning: To reveal a secret

options.A: To let the cat out of the bag
options.B: To kill two birds with one stone
options.C: To hit the nail on the head

questions.explanation: Letting the cat out of the bag means revealing a secret.

questions.question: Meaning: To be very expensive

options.A: To cost an arm and a leg

questions.explanation: Costing an arm and a leg means being very expensive.

questions.question: Meaning: To work late into the night
questions.explanation: Burning the midnight oil means working late.

questions.question: Meaning: To give up
questions.explanation: Throwing in the towel means giving up.

questions.question: Meaning: To ignore someone deliberately
questions.explanation: Giving the cold shoulder means ignoring someone.

questions.question: Meaning: To be in trouble
questions.explanation: Being in hot water means being in trouble.

questions.question: Meaning: To achieve two things at once

options.A: To kill two birds with one stone
options.D: To make a long story short

questions.explanation: Killing two birds with one stone means achieving two goals with one action.

questions.question: Meaning: To be very easy
questions.explanation: Piece of cake means very easy.

questions.question: Meaning: To be extremely happy
questions.explanation: On cloud nine means extremely happy.

questions.question: Meaning: To be very angry

options.B: To be down in the dumps

questions.explanation: Up in arms means very angry.

questions.question: Meaning: To be in the same difficult situation
questions.explanation: In the same boat means in the same difficult circumstances.

questions.question: Meaning: To be undecided
questions.explanation: Sitting on the fence means being undecided.

questions.question: Meaning: To hope for good luck
questions.explanation: Keeping fingers crossed is a gesture of hoping for good luck.

questions.question: Meaning: To manage financially
questions.explanation: Making ends meet means having enough money to live on.

questions.question: Meaning: To agree with someone

options.B: To be on the same page

questions.explanation: Seeing eye to eye means agreeing.

questions.question: Meaning: To avoid the main topic

options.B: To hit the nail on the head

questions.explanation: Beating around the bush means avoiding the main topic.

questions.question: Meaning: To start a conversation
questions.explanation: Breaking the ice means starting a conversation in a social setting.

questions.question: Meaning: To regret something that cannot be changed
questions.explanation: Crying over spilt milk means regretting something that has already happened.

questions.question: Meaning: To face consequences
questions.explanation: Facing the music means accepting the unpleasant consequences.

questions.question: Meaning: To be very kind

options.A: To have a heart of gold
options.B: To have a heart of stone
options.C: To have a heart of steel
options.D: To have a heart of glass

questions.explanation: Having a heart of gold means being very kind.

questions.question: Meaning: To sound familiar
questions.explanation: Ringing a bell means sounding familiar.

questions.question: Meaning: To tease someone
questions.explanation: Pulling someone's leg means teasing them.

questions.question: Meaning: To make a bad situation worse

options.C: To pour salt on a wound

questions.explanation: Adding insult to injury means making a bad situation worse. (Note: 'To add fuel to fire' also means to make a situation worse, but the given idiom is 'add insult to injury')

questions.question: Meaning: To be very rarely
questions.explanation: Once in a blue moon means very rarely.

questions.question: Meaning: To take credit for someone else's idea
questions.explanation: Stealing someone's thunder means taking credit for their idea or achievement.
